General Overview.What is LibraAI?: LibraAI is an AI-powered Smart Library Assistant that helps users search, recommend, and manage books through intelligent chat-based interaction. It's designed to make research faster, smarter, and more personalized.
General Overview.Why was LibraAI created?: It was developed to address common library challenges — such as time-consuming manual searches, lack of personalization, and limited accessibility — by using modern AI technology to improve how students and librarians interact with library systems.
General Overview.Who can access LibraAI?: Anyone! LibraAI is available to students, librarians, and faculty members within a specific institution. You just need to create your library and share it with others. Guest access may be added in future updates.
General Overview.Is LibraAI available on mobile devices?: Yes! LibraAI is fully responsive — it works on laptops, tablets, and smartphones without needing any installation.
General Overview.Can LibraAI work offline?: Not yet. Because LibraAI relies on a cloud-based MongoDB and AI API, an internet connection is required to use its full features.

Student / User Questions.How can I search for books efficiently?: You can use keywords or natural language — for example: 'Find me research papers about data analytics published in 2022.' LibraAI understands context and filters results automatically.
Student / User Questions.Can I filter search results by author or: Yes! The search bar supports filters such as: author: J.K. Rowling, subject: Artificial Intelligence, year: 2023.
How does the AI chatbot help me?: Guide you in using library services
Student / User Questions.Can I favorite or bookmark books?: Yes. You can click the ⭐ 'Add to Favorites' button to keep track of books or papers you plan to read later.
Student / User Questions.How do I make notes while reading?: You can use the Notes Panel, which looks like Notion. Your notes are saved automatically, and you can export them to PDF, DOCX, or Markdown anytime.
Student / User Questions.What if I forget my password?: You can click 'Forgot Password?' on the login page. A reset link will be sent to your registered email.
Student / User Questions.Can I request new books through LibraAI?: Yes! Use the Borrow option, and your librarian will review and approve it based on availability or demand.

What can librarians manage in the system: View analytics and most searched topics
Handle user requests and unanswered chatbot queries
Librarian / Admin Questions.How can librarians handle user feedback?: All chatbot feedback and book requests appear in the Feedback Center, where librarians can approve, reject, or respond to user inputs.

AI & Behavior Questions.How does the chatbot learn new informati: When users ask unanswered questions, librarians can feed those into the FAQ Manager. LibraAI retrains its FAQ dataset periodically.
AI & Behavior Questions.Does LibraAI replace librarians?: No — it assists, not replaces. Librarians still manage physical collections, verify AI data, and maintain system integrity.
AI & Behavior Questions.Can LibraAI summarize PDFs or research p: Yes! Users can upload a PDF, and LibraAI generates a summary, keywords, and highlights using its NLP (Natural Language Processing) model.
AI & Behavior Questions.Does LibraAI support multiple languages?: Currently, LibraAI supports English, but future updates may include Tagalog and other languages for accessibility.
AI & Behavior Questions.Can LibraAI detect plagiarism?: In later updates, LibraAI will include a plagiarism detection module using API integration to help students ensure originality in reports or theses.

Troubleshooting & Support.The chatbot isn't responding — what shou: Check your internet connection and refresh the page. If the issue continues, contact support at support@libraai.edu.ph.
Troubleshooting & Support.My uploaded file didn't process. Why?: Ensure your file is in PDF, DOCX, or TXT format and under the file size limit. The system might reject files that are too large or in unsupported formats.
Clear your browser cache or try using Google Chrome or Edge. The system is optimized for modern browsers.
Troubleshooting & Support.Who do I contact for technical issues?: You can email the development team or librarian support through the 'Email Us' button inside the system.
Troubleshooting & Support.Can LibraAI recommend books by academic: Yes! Future updates will allow course-based filtering.
Troubleshooting & Support.Will AI voice assistant be added?: Voice search and read-aloud features are planned for accessibility in future versions.

Library Hours & Facilities.What are the library's operating hours?: The library is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Monday through Friday. Weekend hours may vary depending on academic schedules or special events.
Library Hours & Facilities.Is the library open during holidays?: No. The library is closed on official holidays and campus breaks. However, LibraAI's online catalog and chatbot remain available 24/7.
Library Hours & Facilities.Can I access the library facilities with: Yes, you may enter the library to browse. However, a valid library card or student ID is required to borrow books.
What facilities are available in the lib: Quiet study areas and reading zones

Borrowing & Returns.How many books can I borrow at once?: Students can borrow up to 5 books at a time for 7 days. Faculty members may borrow up to 10 books for 14 days.
Borrowing & Returns.What happens if I return a book late?: Late returns are subject to a fine of ₱5.00 per day per item. You won't be able to borrow new books until fines are cleared.
Borrowing & Returns.How do I renew borrowed books?: Go to 'My Borrowed Books' in LibraAI and click 'Renew' next to the title. Renewals are allowed once, provided there are no holds from other users.
Borrowing & Returns.What if the book I borrowed is damaged o: Report it immediately to the librarian. You may be asked to replace the book or pay the current market value plus processing fees.
Borrowing & Returns.Can I borrow reference or reserved books: Reference and reserved materials are for in-library use only, but some may be borrowed for short-term use with librarian approval.

Library Policies.Can I eat or drink inside the library?: Food is not allowed, but water in sealed containers is permitted.
Library Policies.What are the rules for using library com: Computers are for academic and research use only. Users must log in with their student credentials and log out after use.
Library Policies.Can I bring my laptop to the library?: Absolutely! Free Wi-Fi and charging stations are provided in designated areas.
Library Policies.What happens if I violate library rules?: Depending on the offense, you may face a temporary suspension of privileges, fines, or disciplinary actions as per school policy.
Library Policies.Are eBooks available in LibraAI?: Yes! LibraAI includes a digital collection of eBooks and PDFs that can be accessed directly online.
